abstract_summ: The 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID‐19) pandemic has created significant challenges to the delivery of care for patients with advanced head and neck cancer requiring multimodality therapy.The COVID‐19 pandemic has upended head and neck cancer care delivery in ways unforeseen and unprecedented.Performing major head and neck ablative surgery and reconstruction is a particular concern given the extended duration and aerosolizing nature of these cases.The moral and professional dimensions of providing ethically appropriate and consistent care for our patients in the COVID‐19 crisis are considered herein for head and neck oncology providers.Support Machinery of the Government and the co-operation of the people are the key factors favouring best practice of head and neck cancer surgery amidst the current COVID 19 crisis.
title_summ: Radiation Oncology in times of COVID-2019: A review article for those in the eye of the storm – An Indian PerspectiveShould breast reconstruction and breast oncoplastic procedures be performed during the coronavirus pandemic?Covid19 pandemic; A practicing head and neck surgeon’s perspective of an institutional modelEthical framework for head and neck cancer care impacted by COVID‐19Major head and neck reconstruction during the COVID‐19 pandemic:The University of Pittsburgh approach
title_abstract_phrases: Ethical framework for head and neck cancer care impacted by COVID‐19The COVID‐19 pandemic has upended head and neck cancer care delivery in ways unforeseen and unprecedented.Major head and neck reconstruction during the COVID‐19 pandemic: The University of Pittsburgh approachThe 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID‐19) pandemic has created significant challenges to the delivery of care for patients with advanced head and neck cancer requiring multimodality therapy.Covid19 pandemic; A practicing head and neck surgeon’s perspective of an institutional model• Surgery for Mucosal Head and neck Cancers needs special consideration as they are AGP, placing the OT staff at a major risk.The moral and professional dimensions of providing ethically appropriate and consistent care for our patients in the COVID‐19 crisis are considered herein for head and neck oncology providers.Should breast reconstruction and breast oncoplastic procedures be performed during the coronavirus pandemic?The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic has changed the face of the treatment of breast cancer and breast reconstruction globally.
